subject: Re: [junit] JDK 1.5 annotations a la nUnit
msgSnippet: ... I m wondering, what is the advantage? Michael -- Michael Schuerig                         Those people who smile a lot mailto:michael@schuerig.de
messageBody:
On Wednesday 26 January 2005 03:46, ezra_epstein wrote:
> I did some work with .NET a while back. The nUnit port was pretty
> cool: annotations, rather than naming conventions, are used to
> indicate test methods.
>
> I'm wondering, now that annotations have been added to Java, is
> anyone working on reverse-porting nUnit? If so, I'm interested in
> helping. If not, anyone else interested in this?

I'm wondering, what is the advantage?

Michael

--
Michael Schuerig Those people who smile a lot
mailto:michael@... Watch the eyes
http://www.schuerig.de/michael/ --Ani DiFranco, Outta Me, Onto You
